latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

item.title: A resolution designating April 2024 as "Second Chance Month".

latestAction.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (text: 4/18/2024 CR S2889-2890)

item.title: Expressing support for the designation of April 2024 as "Second Chance Month".

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote. (consideration: CR S1496; text: CR S1514-1515)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.(consideration: CR S1496; text: CR S1514-1515)

summary.text: This resolution designates April 2023 as Second Chance Month to promote awareness of unnecessary legal and social barriers that prevent individuals with criminal records from becoming productive members of society.

This resolution designates April 2023 as Second Chance Month to promote awareness of unnecessary legal and social barriers that prevent individuals with criminal records from becoming productive members of society.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
